column4: is there any tool in ubuntu which can be used to create a audiovisual flash animation using the storyboard pictures i have
as far as I know there is no program to author flash animations, but there is a program called synergy that can do some great things very similar to Flash(and it uses the storyboard concept)
: by storyboards you mean in what format ? i mean does it need to have an extension
I do not know exactly, I only read up on the tutorials a bit, but never actually used the software
sorry I got the wrong package name, this is the one I meant: http://www.synfig.com/
: i was lost :-) thanks
please don't forget to show us your work when you're done(upload it to youtube "free software animation" or something:D)
: sure ,if it helps.
sudo apt-get install synfig works though:)
anything you can show us already?
: installing it ; but it says its  "vector-based 2D animation package" - wonder if its same as blender!!
nah blender is 3d animation/modelling/rendering. although I love blender
I mean the storyboard and stuff, would be nice to have a sneakpeak
: it needs a SIF file. dont know what it is!! Also came by this -http://youmakemedia.com/2007/02/14/celtx-releases-099/
: there is one more synfigstudio which has GUI . Let me find it helps
oh you were using the command line version? I can't imagine someone doing animation there:D
you should try animating in C or assembly:-P
: yeah. Fortran not a bad choice
cobol is also a choice
this looks quite nice http://www.synfig.com//screenshots/screenshot.png
weird, perhaps you should report a bug and/or try to compile the latest version yourself
joining #synfig is also good:)
: right
